description: Readers respond to a column about the “ghost brand” Smith Brothers.
title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
title_page: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott - The New York Times
text:
Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.
Dear readers, the Campaign Spotlight last week, about new ads seeking to revive the venerable Smith Brothers brand, brought in a number of comments and questions. I am sharing some of those emails below.
■ It’s a very clever campaign. How I wish that the bearded Zack Smith character featured in the commercials really was a descendant of the Smith brothers and not an actor; that would have made the whole thing perfect, if not too good to be true.
At some point you’ll need to poll the ad community on when the whole Williamsburg aesthetic hits the tipping point as a marketing tool. But in the meantime, I will continue to enjoy the blog called Dads are the Original Hipsters, which always makes me smile.
